verses.kjv: There was also a lot for the tribe of Manasseh; for he was the firstborn of Joseph; to wit, for Machir the firstborn of Manasseh, the father of Gilead: because he was a man of war, therefore he had Gilead and Bashan.
verses.ct: Land was also allocated to the tribe of Manasseh, since he was Joseph's firstborn. Machir, Manasseh's firstborn and the father of Gilead, was a warrior, so Gilead and Bashan were given to him.

verses.kjv: There was also a lot for the rest of the children of Manasseh by their families; for the children of Abiezer, and for the children of Helek, and for the children of Asriel, and for the children of Shechem, and for the children of Hepher, and for the children of Shemida: these were the male children of Manasseh the son of Joseph by their families.
verses.ct: Land was also allocated to the remaining descendants of Manasseh, organized by their clans: the descendants of Abiezer, Helek, Asriel, Shechem, Hepher, and Shemida. These were the male descendants of Manasseh son of Joseph, listed by their clans.

verses.kjv: But Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, had no sons, but daughters: and these are the names of his daughters, Mahlah, and Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
verses.ct: But Zelophehad — son of Hepher, son of Gilead, son of Machir, son of Manasseh — had no sons, only daughters. His daughters' names were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.

verses.kjv: And they came near before Eleazar the priest, and before Joshua the son of Nun, and before the princes, saying, The LORD commanded Moses to give us an inheritance among our brethren. Therefore according to the commandment of the LORD he gave them an inheritance among the brethren of their father.
verses.ct: They approached Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the leaders, and said, "The LORD commanded Moses to give us an inheritance among our relatives." So, following the LORD's command, Joshua gave them an inheritance among their father's relatives.

verses.kjv: And there fell ten portions to Manasseh, beside the land of Gilead and Bashan, which were on the other side Jordan;
verses.ct: Manasseh received 10 portions of land, in addition to the territory of Gilead and Bashan on the east side of the Jordan.

verses.kjv: Because the daughters of Manasseh had an inheritance among his sons: and the rest of Manasseh’s sons had the land of Gilead.
verses.ct: This was because the daughters of Manasseh received an inheritance alongside his sons, while the rest of Manasseh's descendants received the territory of Gilead.

verses.kjv: And the coast of Manasseh was from Asher to Michmethah, that lieth before Shechem; and the border went along on the right hand unto the inhabitants of Entappuah.
verses.ct: Manasseh's boundary ran from Asher to Michmethah, which is east of Shechem. The border then extended southward toward the people living at En Tappuah.

verses.kjv: Now Manasseh had the land of Tappuah: but Tappuah on the border of Manasseh belonged to the children of Ephraim;
verses.ct: The territory surrounding Tappuah belonged to Manasseh, but the town of Tappuah itself, located on Manasseh's border, belonged to the descendants of Ephraim.

verses.kjv: And the coast descended unto the river Kanah, southward of the river: these cities of Ephraim are among the cities of Manasseh: the coast of Manasseh also was on the north side of the river, and the outgoings of it were at the sea:
verses.ct: The boundary continued down to the Kanah Ravine, south of the ravine. These cities among Manasseh's towns actually belonged to Ephraim. Manasseh's border ran along the north side of the ravine and ended at the Mediterranean Sea.

verses.kjv: Southward it was Ephraim’s, and northward it was Manasseh’s, and the sea is his border; and they met together in Asher on the north, and in Issachar on the east.
verses.ct: The land to the south belonged to Ephraim, and the land to the north belonged to Manasseh, with the Mediterranean Sea as its western border. Their territory touched Asher on the north and Issachar on the east.

verses.kjv: And Manasseh had in Issachar and in Asher Bethshean and her towns, and Ibleam and her towns, and the inhabitants of Dor and her towns, and the inhabitants of Endor and her towns, and the inhabitants of Taanach and her towns, and the inhabitants of Megiddo and her towns, even three countries.
verses.ct: Within the territories of Issachar and Asher, Manasseh also controlled Beth Shean and its surrounding towns, Ibleam and its surrounding towns, and the people of Dor, Endor, Taanach, and Megiddo with their surrounding towns — these 3 regions with their hills.

verses.kjv: Yet the children of Manasseh could not drive out the inhabitants of those cities; but the Canaanites would dwell in that land.
verses.ct: However, the people of Manasseh were unable to take control of these towns. The Canaanites were determined to remain in that territory.

verses.kjv: Yet it came to pass, when the children of Israel were waxen strong, that they put the Canaanites to tribute, but did not utterly drive them out.
verses.ct: Later, when the Israelites grew stronger, they forced the Canaanites into labor service but never completely drove them out.

verses.kjv: And the children of Joseph spake unto Joshua, saying, Why hast thou given me but one lot and one portion to inherit, seeing I am a great people, forasmuch as the LORD hath blessed me hitherto?
verses.ct: The descendants of Joseph spoke to Joshua and said, "Why have you given us only 1 allotment and 1 portion as our inheritance? We are a large population because the LORD has blessed us so greatly."

verses.kjv: And Joshua answered them, If thou be a great people, then get thee up to the wood country, and cut down for thyself there in the land of the Perizzites and of the giants, if mount Ephraim be too narrow for thee.
verses.ct: Joshua replied, "If you are such a large population, go up into the forested hill country and clear land for yourselves in the territory of the Perizzites and the Rephaim, since the hill country of Ephraim is too small for you."

verses.kjv: And the children of Joseph said, The hill is not enough for us: and all the Canaanites that dwell in the land of the valley have chariots of iron, both they who are of Bethshean and her towns, and they who are of the valley of Jezreel.
verses.ct: The descendants of Joseph responded, "The hill country isn't enough for us, and all the Canaanites living in the valley plains have iron chariots — both those in Beth Shean and its surrounding towns and those in the Valley of Jezreel."

verses.kjv: And Joshua spake unto the house of Joseph, even to Ephraim and to Manasseh, saying, Thou art a great people, and hast great power: thou shalt not have one lot only:
verses.ct: Then Joshua said to the house of Joseph — to both Ephraim and Manasseh — "You are a large population with great strength. You will not have just 1 allotment.

verses.kjv: But the mountain shall be thine; for it is a wood, and thou shalt cut it down: and the outgoings of it shall be thine: for thou shalt drive out the Canaanites, though they have iron chariots, and though they be strong.
verses.ct: The hill country will be yours as well. Even though it is forested, you will clear it, and all of it will belong to you. You will also drive out the Canaanites, even though they have iron chariots and are powerful."
